title: What is Google Charts?

metadata.description: Learn about What is Google Charts? with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Google Maps is a Google API Google Fonts is a Google API Google Charts is a Google API Learn how to add Google Charts to your web page. Example Google Pie Chart Start with a simple basic web page. Add a
element with the id "piechart": Example

My Web Page

Add a reference to the Chart API at google.com: Example And add a JavaScript function: Example ★ +1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
<script type="text/javascript">
// Load google charts
google.charts.load('current', 
  {'packages':['corechart']});
google.charts.setOnLoadCallback(drawChart);
// Draw the chart and set the chart values
function drawChart() {
var data = 
  google.visualization.arrayToDataTable([
['Task', 'Hours per Day'],
['Work', 8],
['Friends', 2],
['Eat', 2],
['TV', 
  2],
['Gym', 2],
['Sleep', 8]
]);
// Optional; add 
  a title and set the width and height of the chart
var options = {'title':'My 
  Average Day', 'width':550, 'height':400};
// Display the chart 
  inside the <div> element with id="piechart"
var chart = new 
  google.visualization.PieChart(document.getElementById('piechart'));
chart.draw(data, options);
}
</script>

summary: This tutorial covers What is Google Charts? concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use What is Google Charts? effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of What is Google Charts? and how to apply it in your projects.
